#summary How to install CSS-X-Fire

= Requirements =

  * An IntelliJ family IDE with CSS capabilities, e.g. one of:
    * [http://www.jetbrains.com/idea/ IntelliJ IDEA] (Ultimate edition)
    * [http://www.jetbrains.com/ruby/ RubyMine]
    * [http://www.jetbrains.com/phpstorm/ PhpStorm]
    * [http://www.jetbrains.com/webstorm/ WebStorm]
    * [http://www.jetbrains.com/pycharm/ PyCharm]
  All of above IDE's are available for a free evaluation period.
  * [http://getfirefox.com/ Firefox] (2.0 - 3.7.x)
  * [http://getfirebug.com/ Firebug] (1.3 - 1.8)

= Details =

  # Install the IDE plugin with the _Plugin Manager_. Restart the IDE when prompted.
    <a href="http://css-x-fire.googlecode.com/svn/images/install_2.png"><img src="http://css-x-fire.googlecode.com/svn/images/install_2.png" width="120" height="80"/></a>
  # After restarting the IDE, CSS-X-Fire will ask if you want to install the _browser plugin_. Click "Yes". This will open the builtin help page of CSS-X-Fire with a link to the browser plugin - *cssxfire.xpi*.
    * _If Firefox is not your default browser just copy the link in the address bar and paste it into Firefox._
    <a href="http://css-x-fire.googlecode.com/svn/images/install_6.png"><img src="http://css-x-fire.googlecode.com/svn/images/install_6.png" width="120" height="80"/></a>
  # Install the browser plugin by clicking on the link. Firefox will ask for permission to allow installation the plugin from an unknown publisher. You need to click "Yes" here. Restart Firefox when prompted.
  # Start styling with pleasure!
